result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark L. Eberling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Waushara Co. Case No. 15CM400.

Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.
Concurrent with: Waushara Co. Case No. 15CM400

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with D. Kramarczyk directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark L. Eberling

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Mark L. Eberling
Current: N8391 5th Ave, Westfield, WI 53964 United States  (Effective: 04-06-2016)
Prior: PO Box 424, Winneconne, WI 54986-0424 United States

15CM400 & 15CM451 Cases called @ 2:37 p.m. Defendant Mark L. Eberling in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CM400: Ct 2 - Guilty. 15CM451: Ct 1 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM400: Ct 1 - DRI. Statement by victim, D.K. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. 

Court orders: 90 days WC Jail on each count concurrent - Huber, GT, 1 days CFTS,  I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: NC w/ D. Kramarczyk, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Restitution in the amount of $582.58 to D.K. and $475.80 to National Government Services Inc, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. The defendant may petition for early termination after 6 months provided all programming is complete and all financial obligations are paid in full. Appeal rights given

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

15CM-400 and 15CM-451 - Both Cases Called @ 2:00 PM: Defendant Mark L. Eberling in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CM-451:    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   ADA argues as to new bond of $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection by SPD as to new bond request.  STC Scheduled as to both matters - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 02:35 pm.
